ThingDef.label: Slouch Hat
ThingDef.description: Based on an ancient Earth tradition, the slouch hat is famous among some of humanities greatest warriors or at least their maddest. The hat originally saw use with the doomed Colonial Rangers, a paramilitary organization that fought rough nations and criminal empires in the Rimworlds before the Awakening. Faced with the insurmountable enemy of both the Mechanoids and Insectoids, the Colonial Rangers collapsed, now nothing more than a few rag tag partisan groups. Now it is found in the hands of collectors of curiosities or in people wanting to invoke an image of heroism without having any of that heroism.

li.vanillaDesc: A stylish hat commonly seen among rangers in the Rimworlds. Though not providing anything more that comfort in the heat, it is beloved by many. Though many complain that the pin used to bend the brim is too sharp.

ThingDef.label: Carapace Armor (Partisan)
ThingDef.description: Before the fall of the Coreworlds, the many armies of the Great Domain saw many servicemen divided into two groups, the Infantry and the Veterancy. While the Infantry was made up of various people from all walks of life, the Veterancy came from ancient nobility and were enhanced mechanically and biologically. This is the equipment of the Infantry, cheap and effective armor based on a plasteel framework with steel reinforcements to ensure an effective armor while being easy to produce compared to the Power Armor of the Veterancy. Its popularity remains after several centuries of usage.\n\n This variant is marked with a skull, commonly seen among partisans.

li.vanillaDesc: A suit of plasteel reinforced plate armor, stronger than a standard flak vest. Provides solid protection against gunfire and melee weapons, while still light enough and resource-efficient to produce. Weaker than power armor in overall protection.

ThingDef.label: Scout Carapace Armor (Partisan)
ThingDef.description: The most important part of any army is the ability to acquire intelligence on their enemies. The Vanguard Carapace Armor was designed on several planets though the most famous and its namesake would be by the Alexandrian Vanguard. During the First War of Alexandria against the Mechanoids, the most important factor in combat was speed. While not being heavy standard Carapace Armor is bulky and could be lightened. The Vanguard did so through removal of the shoulder plates and the “shaving” of certain areas until it only protected the chest of the wearer.\n\n This variant is marked with a skull, commonly seen among partisans.

ThingDef.label: Service Rifle (Bayonet)
ThingDef.description: Once considered the right arm of the free worlds, the partisan Rifle emerged during the great schisms. Before the mechanoid threat, separatists groups armed themselves with this ancient design. After centuries of fighting the Domain, the Bugs, and the Bots, the design has been further streamlined. parts made with polymers or woods changes to shaped steel, fine crafted metal turned to mass production stamps, and quality turned to quantity. Despite this. it is a favorite among mercenaries and colonial militias, some groups have even modified them to take bayonets and other ancient modifications. Now the weapon represents the worlds striving for freedom.\n\nOfficial Name: Armex-Armalite Free License.

li.vanillaDesc: A simplified rifle design built using simpler parts. Light, cheap. and decently accurate, this rifle is considered a favorite in resource poor communities. A simplified design make it so even the poorest colonies are well armed.

ThingDef.label: Bayonet
ThingDef.description: A piece of the original kit for the service rifle, bayonets still were being used in militaries. Not for anything like bayonet charges or massacres, but it was just a nice utility, something used to open cans and used as cooking spits. However, as the situation in the Rimworlds got worse, many found themselves cut off from their supplies, meaning fighting without ammo. Bands of partisans armed with nothing but empty rifles converted into crude spears is what help many Rimworlds from total collapse, even on liberated worlds, this ancient piece of kit is seen now as a symbol of triumph against the odds.\n\nOfficial Name: Armex-Armalite Free License.
